population_method.desc: Complete survey or a statistically robust estimate

bird_report.population_sources: Annual breeding season count (census) at only known breeding sites, Kleides islands and (since 2012 only) Lefkoniso islet, at tip of Karpasia peninsula, from boat. Carried out every May since 2007 by BirdLife Cyprus is conjunction with the Turkish Cypriot bird protection society, Kuskor. Census data published in BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports and quarterly magazines.
bird_report.population_additional_info: Data from the annual BirdLife Cyprus census at Kleides islands: 2007- 19 breeding pairs; 2008- 26p; 2009- 28p, 2010- 15p, 2011- 18p, 2012- 14p. The population estimate covers the whole island. Note that the species occurs only in occupied Cyprus.

population_trend_method.desc: Estimate based on expert opinion with no or minimal sampling

bird_report.population_trend_sources: pre-2007 data based on records in BirdLife Cyprus annual reports (birdwatching records), whereas data for period 2007-12 is of good quality, derived from annual census of breeding islands by BirdLife Cyprus - reported in BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports and quarterly magazine. Trend based on last 6 years' data.

population_trend_long_method.desc: Estimate based on expert opinion with no or minimal sampling

bird_report.population_trend_long_sources: 1987 count data (15 occupied nests) by R.Murray reported in 1987 Cyprus Ornithological Society (1957) 34th bird report and also in Flint & Stewart (1992), The Birds of Cyprus, BOU checklist no.6, second edition. Other pre-2007 data from BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports. From 2007 onwards, from annual census of breeding islands by BirdLife Cyprus - reported in BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports and quarterly magazine.
bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: The 1987 Murray report suggests lower nest numbers in more distant past: 8 nests in 1972, 9 in 1973 and 10 in 1974. The species was fist recorded breeding in 1960 (COS 1960). In subsequent years the colony had six nests in 1961, none in 1966, one in 1968 and 15 in 1987 (de Juana and Varela 1993).

range_method.desc: Complete survey or a statistically robust estimate

bird_report.range_sources: Annual survey of only known breeding colonies, at Kleides islands and Lefkoniso islet (2012 onwards) at tip of Karpasia pensinsula
bird_report.range_additional_info: The distribution and range maps cover the whole island. Note that the species occurs only in occupied Cyprus.

range_trend_method.desc: Complete survey or a statistically robust estimate

bird_report.range_trend_sources: Annual census of breeding area on Karpasia peninsula since 2007

range_trend_long_method.desc: Absent data

bird_report.range_trend_long_sources: 1987 count data (15 occupied nests) by R.Murray reported in 1987 Cyprus Ornithological Society (1957) 34th bird report and also in Flint & Stewart (1992), The Birds of Cyprus, BOU checklist no.6, second edition. Other pre-2007 data from BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports. From 2007 onwards, from annual census of breeding islands by BirdLife Cyprus - reported in BirdLife Cyprus annual bird reports and quarterly magazine.
bird_report.measures_taken: The 1996 SAP recomendation for Cyprus is that suitable sites be checked for breeding, including Kleides islands. Such work has been done by BirdLife Cyprus, while the Cyprus government has been unable to do so due to the occupation of north Cyprus.
bird_report.further_information: Relevant authority is the Game & Fauna Dept., Ministry of Interior, Mr. Nikos Kassinis, lemesos.thira@cytanet.com.cy, Mr. Panicos Panayides, panayides.gf@cytanet.com.cy

bird_report.population_trend_long_sources: More recent records (2000 onwards) as above, pre-2000 records based on winter counts reported in the annual reports of the two Cyprus Ornithological Societies: COS 1957 and COS 1970.
bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: Wintering numbers vary quite widely over the 30-year period (from winter peaks as low as 1,100 individuals to as high as 17,500 individuals), with the fluctuation linked to water levels at the island's two salt lakes (based on expert opinion)

bird_report.population_trend_sources: 6 pairs in period mid-90s to 2001, according to Game & Fuana Service. 7 pairs in 1999, according to Cyprus Forestry department data reported by Cyprus Ornithological Society (COS (1957) annual report for 2000), 34 pairs reported by Game & Fauna Service for 2005 (Kassinis, N. 2009) and 63 pairs (62-64p) according to Game & Fauna Service in 2012

population_trend_long_method.desc: Estimate based on partial data with some extrapolation and/or modelling

bird_report.population_trend_long_sources: Not reported as breeding species prior to 1992. Whaley DJ & Dawes JC, in their 2003 Cyprus breeding birds’ atlas, report first breeding in 1992, another pair in 1997. Also reported as breeding in 1992 and 1993 (1p) by Kourtellarides L 1998. Breeding birds of Cyprus. Bank of Cyprus group, Cyprus. Seven pairs in 1999, according to Cyprus Forestry department data reported by Cyprus Ornithological Society (COS (1957) annual report for 2000). 6 pairs in period mid-90s to 2001, according to Game & Fuana Service. 34 pairs reported by Game & Fauna Service for 2005 (Kassinis, N. 2009) and 63 pairs according to Game & Fauna Service in 2012. Trend calculated taking 1p in 1992 as the starting point.
bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: The species first bred in Cyprus in 1992 (no breeding records exist priot to this year).

range_method.desc: Complete survey or a statistically robust estimate

bird_report.population_sources: 2013 Common Birds Monitoring programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus, with relevant line transect survey data analysed using DISTANCE programme. Also similar analysis of field data from surveys carried out in 2010 and 2011 under an EU-funded programme to revise the Cyprus inventory of Important Bird Areas (a programme that BirdLife Cyprus coordinated). Data from BirdLife Cyprus annual report 2008-2012 and Game & Fauna Service bag statistics reports.
bird_report.population_additional_info: The population estimate covers the whole island

population_trend_method.desc: Estimate based on partial data with some extrapolation and/or modelling

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanderd in 2013 under a Coomon Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmalnd Birds Index for Cyprus.

bird_report.population_sources: Kourtellarides, in his book The Breeding birds of Cyprus (Bank of Cyprus publications -1997) gives an account of last known nest Troodos forest, 1985. Flint & Stewart, in BOU Checklist no.6 (1992) The Birds of Cyprus, note the eagle as a very scarce resident, with possibly 1-2 p in the Troodos range, but most recent confirmed record sighted is from 1960. Species Action Plan notes 2-4p in Cyprus 1993. Whaley & Dawes, in their 2003 Cyprus breeding Birds’ Atlas, note that there are only two recent breeding season reports – August 1994 and April 2000. Only sporadic recent records in BirdLife Cyprus Annual reports, and not in breeding season.
bird_report.population_additional_info: Considered extinct as breeding bird in Cyprus since 1985. The population estimate covers the whole island

bird_report.population_sources: 2013 Common Birds Monitoring programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus, with relevant line transect survey data analysed using DISTANCE programme. Analysis of data from systematic monitoring of four SPA sites by the Game & Fauna service 2007-10, using Distance programme. Unpublished data for the W of Cyprus by proff Derek Pomeroy (2013)Pomeroy & Walsh (2006) Bird censusing and monitoring on Cyprus, Sandgrouse 28 (1):34-43; Bird sightings records as published in BirdLife Cyprus annual reports.
bird_report.population_additional_info: The population estimate covers the whole island

population_trend_method.desc: Estimate based on partial data with some extrapolation and/or modelling

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanderd in 2013 under a Coomon Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmalnd Birds Index for Cyprus.

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanded in 2013 under a Common Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus.

Data from BirdLife Cyprus annual report 2006-2012. Analysis of data from systematic monitoring of four SPA sites by the Game & Fauna service 2007-10, using Distance programme. Unpublished data for the W of Cyprus by proff Derek Pomeroy;

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanded in 2013 under a Common Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus; Bird sightings records as published in BirdLife Cyprus annual reports.

This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus; Also ana;ysis of recent data from counts by Game & Fauna Serrvice

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanded in 2013 under a Common Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus; Also Game & Fauna Service data from monitoring work

bird_report.population_sources: 2013 Common Birds Monitoring programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus, with relevant line transect survey data analysed using DISTANCE programme; Also similar analysis of field data from surveys carried out in some SPAs by Game & Fauna Service; Plus similar analysis of field data from surveys carried out in 2010 and 2011 under an EU-funded programme to revise the Cyprus inventory of Important Bird Areas (a programme that BirdLife Cyprus coordinated); Unpublished analysis of monitoring data for the W of Cyprus by proff Derek Pomeroy; Data from BirdLife Cyprus annual reports 2005-2012.

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanded in 2013 under a Common Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus.

bird_report.population_trend_sources: Analysis of records from line transect survey data for the period 2006-2013 using TRIM software. The data was from line transect surveys carried out under three different but compatible common birds survey programmes (one a 2006-12 pilot programme set up by BirdLife Cyprus and the other a 2006-11 W Cyprus programme operated by Proff Derek Pomeroy). These programmes were merged and expanded in 2013 under a Common Birds Monitoring programme managed by BirdLife Cyprus. This analysis has been detailed in a September 2013 report by BirdLife Cyprus to the Cyprus government, under a contract to produce the Farmland Birds Index for Cyprus.
